snippet: A wrenching national search for solutions to the violence that left 20 children dead in Newtown, Conn., all but ended after the Senate defeated several gun-related measures.
abstract: Senate defeats several measures to expand gun control, all but ending wrenching national search for solutions to violence that left 20 children dead in Newtown, Conn; in rapid succession, bipartisan compromise to expand background checks, ban on assault weapons, and ban on high-capacity gun magazines all fail to get the 60 votes needed.
lead_paragraph: A wrenching national search for solutions to the violence that left 20 children dead in Newtown, Conn., all but ended after the Senate defeated several gun-related measures.

headline.seo: Drive for Gun Control Blocked in Senate
headline.main: Senate Blocks Drive for Gun Control
headline.print_headline:
Gun Control Drive Blocked In Senate;
Obama, In Defeat, Sees ‘Shameful Day’
headline.sub: Federal Action After Newtown Shootings Effectively Derailed
